channel.title: Monster Drops Help
channel.description:
Alright, So I need some help.
The only tuts I'm seeing for drops are for
[code=java]npcdrop = 72 7611 1 1 npcdrop = 72 2621 1 1 npcdrop = 72 2440 1 50 npcdrop = 72 2436 1 50 npcdrop = 72 2442 1 50 npcdrop = 72 2436 1 50 npcdrop = 72 536 1 100[/code]
Now the problem is my source uses this code:
[code=java]public static int Dharok[] = {4716,4718,4720,4722};
public static int randomDharok() { return Dharok[(int)(Math.random()*Dharok.length)];[/code]
So I have a question
1. How do I change the drop rates?

item.title: Monster Drops Help
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

Ahh I know, I saw zero’s new post but not yours. That’s what it was… >.<

Read full topic

item.title: Monster Drops Help
item.dc:creator: @Blackdewman Blackdewman
item.description:
@Blackdewman wrote:

Bah! I knew that you had to add more, common sense dictates that. I just didn’t know if there was actually a number I could just throw in for each item.

Thanks guys.

If a mod could close this, that would be awesome.

Read full topic

item.title: Monster Drops Help
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

[quote=“deathschaos9, post:8, topic:351860”][quote author=Epic Steve link=topic=448216.msg3289434#msg3289434 date=1280440383]

drop rate is the last integer in npcdrops.cfg
100 = always
0 = never
50 = sometimes, sometimes not

More specifically, that last integer is the % chance of the drop

And for the second one, to make the chances of getting dharoks less, add more items to the array (Such as ashes)

public  static int Dharok[] = { 4716,4718,4720,4722, 592, 592, 592, 592, 592, 592, 592, 592, 592 };

Thanks for repeating what I just said in much less detail, haha.
[/quote]

Did you edit your post because I swear I didn’t see that when I replied =[/quote]
Nope it’s always been there, hah. ^.^

Read full topic

item.title: Monster Drops Help

item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

[quote=“Epic Steve, post:6, topic:351860”][quote author=deathschaos9 link=topic=448216.msg3289431#msg3289431 date=1280440292]

drop rate is the last integer in npcdrops.cfg
100 = always
0 = never
50 = sometimes, sometimes not

More specifically, that last integer is the % chance of the drop

And for the second one, to make the chances of getting dharoks less, add more items to the array (Such as ashes)

public  static int Dharok[] = { 4716,4718,4720,4722, 592, 592, 592, 592, 592, 592, 592, 592, 592 };

[/quote]
Thanks for repeating what I just said in much less detail, haha. ;)[/quote]

Did you edit your post because I swear I didn’t see that when I replied =\

Read full topic

item.title: Monster Drops Help
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][quote author=Epic Steve link=topic=448216.msg3289426#msg3289426 date=1280440219]
The way the second code works is that chooses a random item ID from the list. If you wish to make one item drop more frequent you’d add more of the same item ID. For example, if you wanted the Gold (Item ID: 995) to drop the most frequent, it would look like this.

public static int Dharok[] = {995,995,995,995,995,995,4716,4718,4720,4722};

Now, the drop rate is 5/10 gold… Half the time it’s gold… Half the time it’s one of the other 4 items.
The drop rate for item ID 4716 is 1/10… Making this item more rare.

If you wish to make the item drop rarer, you do the opposite, make it less frequent by increasing the number of other items in the array. For example, to make Gold rare. You’d do this.

public static int Dharok[] = {995,4716,4716,4718,4718,4720,4720,4722,4722};

Now Gold only has a 1/9 chance of being dropped, whereas the rest of the items all have a 2/9 chance of being dropped.
[/quote]
The first one is 6/10.
You said 5/10.[/quote]
Thanks for that, typo.

Read full topic

drop rate is the last integer in npcdrops.cfg

[/quote]
More specifically, that last integer is the % chance of the drop

And for the second one, to make the chances of getting dharoks less, add more items to the array (Such as ashes)

public  static int Dharok[] = { 4716,4718,4720,4722, 592, 592, 592, 592, 592, 592, 592, 592, 592 };

Thanks for repeating what I just said in much less detail, haha.

item.title: Monster Drops Help
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

The way the second code works is that chooses a random item ID from the list. If you wish to make one item drop more frequent you’d add more of the same item ID. For example, if you wanted the Gold (Item ID: 995) to drop the most frequent, it would look like this.

public static int Dharok[] = {995,995,995,995,995,995,4716,4718,4720,4722};

Now, the drop rate is 6/10 gold… Half the time it’s gold… Half the time it’s one of the other 4 items.
The drop rate for item ID 4716 is 1/10… Making this item more rare.

If you wish to make the item drop rarer, you do the opposite, make it less frequent by increasing the number of other items in the array. For example, to make Gold rare. You’d do this.

public static int Dharok[] = {995,4716,4716,4718,4718,4720,4720,4722,4722};

Now Gold only has a 1/9 chance of being dropped, whereas the rest of the items all have a 2/9 chance of being dropped.

Read full topic
